dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1448 IH: Defend America’s Rural Energy Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Feenstra (for himself, Mr. Van Orden, Mr. Lawler, Mr. Guest, and Mr. Higgins of Louisiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committees on Foreign Affairs, and Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 to prohibit investment by foreign adversaries in United States real estate suitable for renewable energy or renewable fuels production, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defend America’s Rural Energy Act of 2023 or the DARE Act of 2023.

section.header: Transactions relating to United States real estate suitable for renewable energy or renewable fuels production
section.text: Section 721 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 (50 U.S.C. 4565) is amended—

clause.text: in clause (i), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (ii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
any transaction described in subparagraph (B)(vi) that is proposed, pending, or completed on or after the date of the enactment of this clause.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: Any acquisition of, or transfer of an interest to, a foreign government or an entity acting on behalf of a foreign government with respect to—

subclause.text: agricultural land used to grow corn and soybeans for the purpose of renewable energy; or
land used for wind turbines or other wind energy production.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition with respect to certain transactions relating to real estate suitable for renewable energy or renewable fuels production

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a covered country (or a person acting on behalf of a covered country) may not acquire any interest with respect to land described in subclause (I) or (II) of subsection (a)(4)(B)(vi).
In this subsection, the term covered country means each of the following:
